message.content:
Probabilistic Methods, Rule Learning. 

Probabilistic Methods: The paper discusses decision graphs as an extension of decision trees, which are a common probabilistic method used in AI. Decision graphs are also described as a way to represent probability distributions over decision variables.

Rule Learning: Decision trees are a type of rule learning algorithm, and decision graphs can be seen as an extension of this approach. The paper discusses how decision graphs can be used to represent complex decision rules, and how they can be learned from data using techniques such as maximum likelihood estimation.
